Hello. I have just set up github for the first time. Loaded our 2024 code onto it. Then went to see if I could open the code back up in the WPI visual studio. When I opened up the WPI 2024, the code was there, but the WPI command pallet was no longer there. Something called “codespaces” seemed to be operating. How do I get the WPI commands back? Thanks.

Thanks. Just tried that. No luck. Still no WPI symbol on the right in the VS studio. No WPI commands. I reloaded it, and it wants the codespaces extension still. How do I reload it, have it go to the start page, then paste in the url from github?

Take a look at Create devcontainer.json by ArchdukeTim · Pull Request #44 · frc78/FRC78_2024 · GitHub

This installs the vscode extension into the github codespace.

Though I don’t recommend codespaces. They’re not free, even for teams on the non-profit plan or whatever it is.

You should use the VSCode desktop app. See WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Rereading the post, it seems like you didn’t intend to open the code in codespaces. I suggest reading Cloning a repository - GitHub Docs

Hello. Thanks. I didn’t want codespace (hadn’t heard of it). Now I can’t seem to get away from it. I installed the desktop ap. on a second computer, just to try from fresh. When I try to open the code from codespace, the WPILib disappears. If I download it first from GitHub, then open it, the WPILib is there. I will read the documentation that you sent. Really appreciate it. Thanks.

Mara1:

WPILib disappears

I assume you got your github repository clone address as suggested by the references from ArchdukeTim and used them in VSC by opening VSC and clicking on the Source Control icon on the left margin of the screen.

I don’t know what happened to the W icon (I never have one, either) but I open the WPILib palette by clicking the triple dots in the upper right corner or Top Menu item View / Command Palette or Ctrl-Shift-P.
